snippet: A primary goal of the drill, scheduled for November, is to explore how governments would react as the loss of the grid cripples the supply chain for everyday necessities.
abstract: Thousands of utility workers, business executives, National Guard officers, federal antiterrorism experts and other officials in the United States, Canada and Mexico are preparing for an emergency drill in November; practice will simulate physical attacks and cyberattacks that could take down large sections of the power grid.
lead_paragraph: A primary goal of the drill, scheduled for November, is to explore how governments would react as the loss of the grid cripples the supply chain for everyday necessities.

headline.main: As Worries Over the Power Grid Rise, a Drill Will Simulate a Knockout Blow
headline.print_headline: As Worries Over the Power Grid Rise, a Drill Will Simulate a Knockout Blow
